reviewText:
English review:

I write this review only as a small service. It seems like this game is getting many negative reviews simply because it's in Russian. As a disclaimer, I am American and cannot speak or read Russian. However, this only proves to be an issue when navigating the menus. As for the actual game, as long as you've played a decent number of shooters, it should be fairly straightforward. Anybody with reasonable experience playing shooters should have no problem getting through the tutorial level. WADS moves you, ctrl crouches, left click to shoot, right click to aim, space to jump. How hard is that? There are some interesting wall jumping and quick moving mechanics present and the gameplay feels pretty solid, especially for a free-to-play game. The graphics look dated, but that really is not a big deal. Again, it is free-to-play, what do you expect?

As for the pay-to-win system, well it doesn't really seem like pay-to-win. I did fine against Russian players who, apart from having the advantage of understanding the whole game, seemed to have purchased better gear than me. Although I did not win, I was not in last place either.

Obviously I am not going to be playing this game a lot and I probably will end up uninstalling simply because of the language barrier. But to down-vote a seemingly good game (especially one that is free), just because it is not in your language is just close-minded and stupid. Just because a game is in another language does not mean that it is bad.


Русский обзор (предоставляется Google Translate):

Я пишу этот отзыв только как дополнительный сервис. Похоже, эта игра становится много отрицательных отзывов просто потому, что в русском языке. Как отказ, я американец и не может говорить или читать по-русски. Однако, это только доказывает, чтобы быть проблемой, когда перемещение по меню. Что касается собственно игры, до тех пор, как вы играли в приличное количество стрелков, он должен быть достаточно простым. Любой с разумными опыт игры стрелков не должны иметь никаких проблем с получением через уровень учебник. Пыжи перемещает вас, Ctrl приседает, щелкните левой кнопкой мыши, чтобы стрелять, щелкните правой кнопкой мыши, чтобы прицелиться, пробел, чтобы прыгать. Как трудно это? Есть некоторые интересные прыжки стены и быстро движущиеся механика присутствует и геймплей чувствует себя довольно твердый, особенно для игры бесплатно-игры. Графика выглядит устаревшей, но это действительно не имеет большого значения. Опять же, это бесплатно-игры, что вы ожидаете?

Что касается системы платного к победе, ну на самом деле не кажется, что платить к победе. Я сделал штрафа в отношении российских игроков, которые, помимо имея преимущество понимания всю игру, казалось, приобрели более передачу, чем мне. Хотя я не выиграл, я не был на последнем месте либо.

Очевидно, что я не собираюсь играть в эту игру много, и я, вероятно, будет в конечном итоге удалить просто из-за языкового барьера. Но вниз голосовать, казалось бы, хорошую игру (особенно тот, который является бесплатным), только потому, что это не в Ваш язык просто закрыть настроенных и глупо. Просто потому, что игра на другом языке, не означает, что это плохо.

The story of this game for me:
>I was browsing the free to play section of steam when I see this game
>I see the reviews are mixed and I wonder if it's any good or not
>I see that English is not a supported language,only Russian
>I am pretty good at Russian so I imagined I wouldn't have a hard time reading things in the game
>I imagined that most of the negative reviews come from people who can't read Russian
>I download the game
>I wait some 20 minutes for it to download
>I was happy to see the game is downloaded
>I clicked on play
>I saw that nothing has been happing for 10 seconds
>.......
>Then a startup error screen popped up
>I rage and uninstall the game


I rate the game -10/10
You will hate this game even if you speak Russian.

reviewText:
Average mix between a counterstrike/generic f2p shooter, kind of like Crossfire/Combat arms but not really. Everything is in Russian so good luck trying to figure out the controls let alone volume control or anything of that sort. Game was okay, not great and not really a turd in the bucket of johns either. Not sure if the English version of the game failed or if the game was just marketed to Russians in the first place, but if it was in English it might draw a small community of Combat Arms type players I suppose. Oh and I think there might be some cloak/invisibility type thing but I didn't see it in play other than a team mate using it in spawn briefly. Usually games that have invisibility ♥♥♥♥ING SUCK.

reviewText:
(TL:DR at the end)
For whatever reason the game only counts you being on it on steam when the loading bar is up. My actual hours are roughly 60.
Also, this is mostly describing gameplay. The first two and the last two paragraphs talk about the other aspects you should be aware of, in case you don't wish to read what the game is like.

Run and fire is quite an interesting game, to say the least. The first thing that should be noted, is the download size is not 100 Mb as it says. It is around 4000.

One of the major turnoffs is that the language is all russian, making the vast majority of players unable to enjoy it. I downloaded google translate on my phone and held the camera up to my screen to navigate through the tutorial and menus, and I still do when new popups come. It obviously has a hard time with the blur from a screen on another screen, and the translations being strange at times, but it got me through and now I don't use it very often, I can buy gear, change my loadout, go into matches etc. without needing it too often.

As for the game details, Yes it is another fps. The graphics are very pretty, and runs extremely well, even on a potato for a computer. It should be noted that I use a game boosting software, but I average roughly 40-50 frames solid, and believe me this is NOT a gaming computer.

Gameplay, is pretty standard for most fps. Automatic weapons dominate as with all shooters, though for some reason a lot less than most other games. There is no ADS on weapons unless you specifically put one on using the ingame currency(The game uses a time system for almost all purchases, I will get more into it later) or snipers, I have little experience with them but it seems that the hipfire" is quite accurate anyways

reviewText: This game is absolutely fantastic despite the language. I don't understand Russian in any way but the voice acting is good, the controls are simple, and the matches are quick. It's easy to go through the tutorial and controls, really.. The Google Translate camera capture feature is your good friend (don't bother to scan, just point the camera at the screen and go along the words). Still unable to grasp the controls? Don't worry..! Use your basic movement controls from other FPS games. Like moving - WASD. Switching of weapons - number buttons / mouse(?). Picking up weapons or ammo - E. This game has cool tricks too like dashing, charged jumping and wall-running. How? Either double-tap your move controls or your spacebar, depends on your class. It's a neat little trick this game has that makes it unique. You can even charge your fist when you're using your knife in tutorial with the right-click! Definitely amazing, isn't it? Now have a go and have fun!

reviewText:
If you have half a brain, the language barrier will be a small issue that will not get in the way of enjoying the core gameplay. Even without being able to read a lick of Russian, I was able to create an account, get into a server, compare gun stats, buy a gun and accessories, and start a match.

Anyone who gives this a negative review because of the game being in Russian probably should have read some reviews or maybe checked the language compatability before downloading.

This is a very fun game. The shooting mechanics are well done, and that's something that F2P shooters screw up a lot. Your gun doesn't jump violently every shot as it would in real life, but you still need to burst fire to hit anything at range. Not entirely realisitc, but who cares, it's a game.

This game will most likely die just like it did before, but I intend on enjoying it while it lasts. Repulse was fun as hell and I'm glad to see it back, even if it is in Russian.

reviewText: This game is good for what it is. It works exactly like any other FPS game and has an odd resemblance to CS 1.6. Dev team, this game will probably get better reviews and more players if you add English. It's not hard to get the basics of it though, even if it's Russian. If you honestly can't work your way out just because it's a different language, you're an idiot. Many russian words are similar to English. Energy in Russian is pronounced almost the exact same way it is in English, for example. I'll give this game a 10/10, simply because I haven't encountered any bugs, and the community isn't salty.

I don't know russian. That being said... if you don't know what it says... use google translate on your phone and aim it at the screen, boom, now you know what it says. So all of you stupid people who can't problem solve... go jump off a cliff.

This game is much better balanced than many other F2P games. I admit there is a bit of pay to win leeway, BUT the default weapons are still viable.

I enjoy it enough to take my time to search what words mean.
